intro: Sphaeralcea glabrata, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky slopes. The plant features small, spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical characteristics include a compact growth habit and the ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Sphaeralcea glabrata is also known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various wildlife species.
